intro: Barkeria lindleyana subsp. vanneriana, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to parts of South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. The subspecies vanneriana is distinguished by its smaller, more vibrant flowers compared to the typical form.
